fields.name: BAME Labour
fields.description: BAME Labour is the institution tasked with representing Labour's 'Black, Asian, and Minority Ethnic' (BAME) members.  Other proposals relating to the representation of BAME people in the Labour Party should be submitted under Track 2 (Representation of BAME and LGBT members).
fields.guidance: Although the January 12th deadline for individual submissions has passed, CLPs and Ethnic Minority Forums can continue to make submisisons after the deadline, and the debate over the future of BAME Labour will continue. Please have a look at our proposed submission and let us know what you think.

fields.name: Young Labour
fields.description: Young Labour is the body which represents the party's younger members (defined as people aged under 27).
fields.guidance: Although the January 12th deadline for individual submissions has passed, CLPs and Young Labour Forums can continue to make submisisons after the deadline, and the debate over the future of Young Labour will continue. Please have a look at our proposed submission and let us know what you think.

fields.name: Women's Conference
fields.description: Women's Conference is a special Conference for female delegates representing women members of the party.  It was historically used by women to pass their own policy and submit it to annual Conference.
fields.guidance: Although the January 12th deadline for individual submissions has passed, CLPs and Women's Forums can continue to make submisisons after the deadline, and the debate over the future of Women's Conference will continue. Please have a look at our proposed submission and let us know what you think.

fields.guidance: In need of inspiration? Check out these brilliant articles full of ideas for revitalising CLPs in New Socialist: Corbynism from Below by Tom Blackburn, and Chorley Socialist Club by Sean Cummings.
fields.description: Strengthening the involvement and participation of our hundreds of thousands of new members in constituency parties and other aspects of the Party’s work.  This is a broad theme covering all reforms that enhance the involvement and participation of members which are not dealt with under other themes.

fields.name: Momentum’s Submissions to Transform BAME Labour
fields.summary: Momentum sent a survey to our Black, Asian and Minority Ethnic members and supporters asking about their experiences and expectations relating to BAME Labour, eliciting over 1000 responses. The responses paint a dismal picture of a failing organisation. In response, Momentum has formulated these proposals for a fully autonomous, resourced, transparent, organisation capable of overcoming institutional racism, engaging with BAME voters and empowering BAME members.
fields.text: The document listed below contains Momentum's submission to the Labour Party Democracy Review for this theme.  Please read it and let us know what you think in the comments section below.

fields.name: Momentum Submission to Transform Young Labour
fields.summary: In order to fully harness the talent, creativity, and ideological commitment to transforming society of our young members, Young Labour must be allowed fully autonomy, fair representation in party structures, resources commensurate to its membership. This proposal outlines some basic requirements to reform Young Labour into an organisation capable of unleashing the creative of potential of hundreds and thousands of committed young people moved by the desire to transform society.
fields.text: The document listed below contains Momentum's submission to the Labour Party Democracy Review for this theme.  Please read it and let us know what you think in the comments section below.

fields.name: Suggestions for Women’s Conference
fields.summary: These proposals were drawn up by Teresa Clark and Jean Crocker based on consultations with female activists from around the country. They attempt to reconstitute Women’s Conference as a meaningful institution that allows female party members to develop policy and empower women.
fields.text: The document listed below contains Momentum's submission to the Labour Party Democracy Review for this theme.  Please read it and let us know what you think in the comments section below.

fields.name: Members' Council Recommendations to Improve CLP Governance
fields.summary: Momentum’s Members’ Council met on the 2nd December 2017 to develop recommendations for the Democracy Review. Their recommendations put a strong focus on improving transparency over key documents such as standing orders, increasing clarity over data rules (which may be altered in line with upcoming legislation), and improving accessibility for people with disabilities and people unable to attend meetings, including through online voting, which was widely popular.
fields.text: The document listed below contains Momentum's submission to the Labour Party Democracy Review for this theme.  Please read it and let us know what you think in the comments section below.

fields.name: Momentum NCG Proposal for a Charter of Members’ Rights
fields.summary: A Charter of Members’ Rights is necessary to remake the Labour Party so that it is structurally and culturally coherent with democratic socialist principles. Given the massive potential of the incredible expansion of the party membership in recent years, it is necessary to ensure that the talent, creativity, and commitment of the members is fully harnessed. This Charter includes key relevant recommendations to protect and expand members’ rights.
fields.text: The document listed below contains Momentum's submission to the Labour Party Democracy Review for this theme.  Please read it and let us know what you think in the comments section below.

fields.name: Momentum NCG Proposal for a Code of Ethics
fields.summary: Remaking the Labour Party so that it can transform the lives of millions of people will only be possible if there is a fundamental cultural change instigated throughout the length and breadth of the party. This cultural change needs to be built on commitments by all actors in the party to mutual respect, engagement and participation, transparency, and accountability. The objective of this Code of Ethics is to establish a basis for this cultural transformation.
fields.text: The document listed below contains Momentum's submission to the Labour Party Democracy Review for this theme.  Please read it and let us know what you think in the comments section below.

fields.name: Momentum NCG Proposal for a Labour Party Ombudsperson
fields.summary: This proposal argues for the creation of the role of an ombudsperson to enforce the Charter of Rights and Code of Ethics. It is essential that the ombudsperson is accountable to the NEC and that their work does not cut across other NEC functions. However, the ombudsperson must personally be truly independent and command widespread support and command widespread support across the party as a whole.
fields.text: The document listed below contains Momentum's submission to the Labour Party Democracy Review for this theme.  Please read it and let us know what you think in the comments section below.

fields.name: Members’ Council Recommendations for the National Policy Forum
fields.summary: The Members’ Council met on December 2nd. They developed recommendations to radically reform the National Policy Forum, so that there continues to be a rolling body of policymaking, but that it is more responsive to party members, has more support to develop meaningful policy, and is able to feed back into CLPs to ensure party members are able to engage with it effectively, as well as changes made to democratise and strengthen Conference as the party’s sovereign decision-making body.
